xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Recent Patents on Engineering, Recent Patents on Computer Science, The Open Nanoscience Journal, the International Journal of Internet Protocol Technology, the Journal of Internet Technology, ISRN Signal Processing, and ISRN Machine Vision. He has served as a steering member, committee member, and session chair for numerous professional conferences and workshops. He has received numerous grants from National Science Foundation, Navy and Air Force, and Industry. He was the recipient of Research Initiation Award of NSF and Board of Overseers Excellence in Research Award of NJIT.

Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering

head.citation-title: Discrimination of Computer Generated and Photographic Images Based on CQWT Quaternion Markov Features
head.abstracts: Â© 2019 World Scientific Publishing Company.In this paper, an effective method based on the color quaternion wavelet transform (CQWT) for image forensics is proposed. Compared to discrete wavelet transform (DWT), the CQWT provides more information, such as the quaternion's magnitude and phase measures, to discriminate between computer generated (CG) and photographic (PG) images. Meanwhile, we extend the classic Markov features into the quaternion domain to develop the quaternion Markov statistical features for color images. Experimental results show that the proposed scheme can achieve the classification rate of 92.70%, which is 6.89% higher than the classic Markov features.
